newsitem.title: USA: Fire destroys at least 60 homes north of San Diego.
newsitem.headline: Fire destroys at least 60 homes north of San Diego.

text.p: A raging wildfire destroyed at least 60 homes in a small town north of San Diego, police said Tuesday.

Lt. Greg Fried, a police spokesman in the coastal community of Carlsbad, said the original damage estimate was "extremely conservative" and that 80 or more homes may actually have been lost in the 5,000-acre (2,000-hectare) blaze.
The fire broke out in the Elfin Forest Recreational Reserve Monday afternoon and quickly spread to nearby canyons lined with homes about 15 miles (25 km) north of San Diego.
Flames cut a path of destruction not only in Carlsbad but in the neighboring town of San Marcos, but there was no immediate word on the extent of damage there.
Dozens of Carlsbad residents were evacuated, and one firefighter suffered smoke inhalation and had to be taken to a local hospital. The cause of the blaze was under investigation.
Hundreds of firefighters had the fire contained by early Tuesday. "The winds have abated and we're holding our breath and hoping they don't pick up again," Fried said.
